title: Facebook Feels $10 Billion Sting From Apple’s Privacy Push
sub_head: Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg says adjusting to the iPhone maker’s app-tracking changes will take time
body:
Facebook ’s parent company served up the starkest sign yet of how Apple Inc.’s new ad-privacy policy is roiling the digital-advertising world.
Discussing Meta Platforms Inc.’s quarterly earnings and its outlook for the current year that shocked investors, Chief Financial Officer David Wehner on Wednesday said the company expects the Apple policy to cost it more than $10 billion in lost sales for 2022. That is equivalent to about 8% of its total revenue last year.
